conclusion: Problem involves finding electric field strength at intersection of diagonals of a square with charges at corners.
Square with points A, B, C, D at corners; +q charges at A and B, -q charges at C and D.
Intersection of diagonals is the center of the square.
Center is equidistant from all four points.
Distance from any corner to center is L/√2.
Electric field due to point charge follows inverse square law, E ∝ 1/r².
Need to find electric field due to each charge at point O and add them vectorially.
Electric field due to positive charge +q is E = k * q / r², direction away from charge.
Electric field due to negative charge -q is E = k * q / r², direction towards charge.
At point O, distances from all four charges are L/√2.
Points A and C are along one diagonal, B and D along the other, which are perpendicular.
Electric fields due to charges at A and C are along AC diagonal; B and D along BD diagonal.
Net E along AC: E_A - E_C; Net E along BD: E_B - E_D.
All E's have the same magnitude, 2 * k * q / L².
